channel.title: Uploads, Jagex involved?
channel.description: Hey guys, i wanted to know your opinion about jagex, do you think that they're giving fight by taking down our servers, or it's just coincidence? I've reuploaded my server about 3 times in the last 2 days.

item.title: Uploads, Jagex involved?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:56, topic:469488”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=586688.msg4168640#msg4168640 date=1353986993]
THE love U TALKING ABOUT

and i dont think that this:

tut or a snippet to remove the jagex stuff

would happen j/s
[/quote]
Well it’d probably happen, somone i believe has already released a legal cryption class.[/quote]

Isaac cipher…

and the server could still be declared illegal for using their protocol and|or using ANY client code.

e.g: optimizeText(), xlate tables, etc

Read full topic

item.title: Uploads, Jagex involved?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:56, topic:469488”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=586688.msg4168640#msg4168640 date=1353986993]
THE love U TALKING ABOUT

and i dont think that this:

tut or a snippet to remove the jagex stuff

would happen j/s
[/quote]
Well it’d probably happen, somone i believe has already released a legal cryption class.[/quote]
Yeah, but the reason I said, “dafuq” was mainly because it’s literally impossible to remove everything “owned by jagex”. The whole client is owned by Jagex. Even if you redid every class, you’d still have to remodel everything and redesign everything in order for it to be yours instead of Jagex’s, but even then it wouldn’t be the same game.

Read full topic

item.title: Uploads, Jagex involved?

item.description:

where would that be?

plus i think there is more to it
and if this is true

Doesnt it include their intellectual property by using their protocol?

Then i don’t think it would make a difference

and maybe they take servers down too because its related to the cache?

i dont know just a thought

Read full topic

item.title: Uploads, Jagex involved?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:4, topic:469488”]Is this actually happening? I am curious if the links are just being outdated or they are actually being removed…

If they are being removed, Jagex has NO right to do so. They own ZERO part of a server unless it comes bundled with a client.[/quote]
Doesnt it include their intellectual property by using their protocol?

Read full topic

item.title: Uploads, Jagex involved?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:46, topic:469488”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=586688.msg4165798#msg4165798 date=1353701984]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=586688.msg4165563#msg4165563 date=1353656069]

I know this is a conspiracy but this has been happening ever since a person named MMG_ registered.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=568307
[/quote]I doubt Mod MMG lives in California (from IP) or uses an AOL email address

I’m not saying classic’s theory is true but you know as well as I do the IP could be spoofed and the AOL email address could be something to hide his identity. Not that naming himself MMG done him any favours.
[/quote]Back when I was recovering accounts (while it was “legal” here) a lot of the Jagex staff accounts had AOL/Yahoo emails attached to them. Just sayin’[/quote]
A shame its not aloud to be discussed here anymore or anything like that
NOT THAT I DID THAT

But I’m sure they use regular email providers too, or to make it seem normal or something?

Read full topic

item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:32, topic:469488”]RandQm, the equivalent of your stream methods using a ByteBuffer.

I believe Advocatus rewrote the input and output buffers using a NIO ByteBuffer, you can find it on Rune-Server, to either use, or reference off of. Your choice.[/quote]
still using the runescape protocol still illegal.
